meanings.definition: Having an even and regular surface or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The baby's skin felt smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The glass surface was smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The smooth ice cream melted quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth voice was like a gentle breeze on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The smooth road ahead promised an easy journey.

meanings.sent1: The polished stone was smooth and cool.
meanings.sent2: The silk fabric felt smooth against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The smooth dance moves of the penguin made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His smooth manners charmed everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The smooth surface of the lake reflected the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: To make (something) smooth by rubbing or applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to smooth out the wrinkles in the fabric.
meanings.sent2: He carefully smoothed the clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to smooth out the lumps in the gravy.
meanings.sent4: The artist smoothed the paint on the canvas with long strokes.
meanings.sent5: The gardener smoothed the soil before planting the seeds.
